sen.j: 観世 元信（かんぜ・もとのぶ、1931年8月8日-）は日本の能楽師。
sen.e: Motonobu KANZE (August 8, 1931 -) is a performer of traditional Japanese Noh drama.
Motonobu KANZE (August 8, 1931 -) is a performer of traditional Japanese Noh drama.
Motonobu KANZE (August 8, 1931 -) is a performer of traditional Japanese Noh drama.

sen.j: 能楽観世流囃子方大鼓方十六世宗家。
sen.e: Motonobu KANZE is the 16th generation head of the Kanze family school of Noh and, plays the large Japanese hand drum ('Okawa').
Motonobu KANZE is the 16th generation head of the Kanze family school of Noh and, plays the large Japanese hand drum ('Okawa').
Motonobu KANZE is the 16th generation head of the Kanze family school of Noh, Music department, large hand drum division (Otsuzumi).
He is a member of the Japan Noh Association,
He is a member of the Japan Noh Association,
He is a member of the Association for Japanese Noh Plays,

sen.j: 1931年 囃子方大鼓方観世元継の長男として東京に生まれる。
sen.e: Born in Tokyo 1931; eldest son of Mototsugu KANZE.
Born in Tokyo 1931; eldest son of Mototsugu KANZE.
Born in Tokyo 1931; eldest son of Mototsugu KANZE.

sen.j: 1946年 祖父の囃子方大鼓方十五世宗家観世元規が死去し、宗家を継承。
sen.e: In 1946, Motonobu KANZE's grandfather Motonori KANZE (15th generation performer of the large Japanese hand drum ('Okawa') in musical ensembles accompanying Noh performances) died and subsequently, Motonobu succeeded his grandfather as head of the family.

In 1946, Motonobu KANZE's grandfather Motonori KANZE (15th generation performer of the large Japanese hand drum ('Okawa') in musical ensembles accompanying Noh performances) died and subsequently, Motonobu succeeded his grandfather as head of the family.

In 1946, Motonobu KANZE's grandfather Motonori KANZE (15th generation performer of the large Japanese hand drum in musical ensembles accompanying Noh performances) died and subsequently, Motonobu succeeded his grandfather as head of the family.
Motonobu made his first appearance onstage in the 1947 production of `Iwabune` (lit. `Stone Boat`).
Motonobu made his first appearance onstage in the 1947 production of `Iwabune` (lit. `Stone Boat`).
Motonobu made his first appearance onstage in the 1947 production of 'Iwabune' (lit. 'Stone Boat').

sen.j: 1950年 学習院大学文学部に入学。
sen.e: 1950: Entered Gakushuin University Literature Faculty.
1950: Entered Gakushuin University Literature Faculty.
1950: Entered Gakushuin University Literature Faculty.

sen.j: 1952年 東京藝術大学非常勤講師となる。
sen.e: 1952: Became a part time lecturer at the Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music.
1952: Became a part time lecturer at the Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music.
1952: Became a part time lecturer at the Tokyo University of the Arts.

sen.j: 1954年 学習院大学文学部文学科国文学専攻卒業。
sen.e: 1954: Graduated Gakushuin University Literature Faculty with a major in Japanese Literature.
1954: Graduated Gakushuin University Literature Faculty with a major in Japanese Literature.
1954: Graduated Gakushuin University Literature Faculty with a major in Japanese Literature.

sen.j: 同年初めての能楽使節団の一員としてイタリア・ビエンナーレ演劇祭に参加。
sen.e: The same year traveled to the Biennale in Italy to perform as a member of a Noh touring troupe.
The same year traveled to the Biennale in Italy to perform as a member of a Noh touring troupe.
The same year traveled to the Biennale in Italy to perform as a member of a Noh touring troupe.
1959: Performed the role of `Ojishi` in the classic Noh play called `Shakkyo`) (lit. Stone Bridge).
1959: Performed the role of `Ojishi` in the classic Noh play called `Shakkyo`) (lit. Stone Bridge).
1959: Motonobu played a part in the classic Noh play called 'Shakkyou Ojishi' (石橋大獅子)
sen.cmt: 意味が違っていると思うので再構成しました。

sen.j: 「道成寺」・「乱」・「石橋」等の大曲・秘曲を含め数多くの舞台を勤める。
sen.e: Performed in a large number of major roles, and roles limited to being performed approved family-lines of performers (`hikkyoku` restricted roles) in plays such as: `Dojo-ji Temple`, `Rebellion`, `Shakkyo` (lit. Stone Bridge) etc.

Performed in a large number of major roles, and roles limited to being performed approved family-lines of performers (`hikkyoku` restricted roles) in plays such as: `Dojo-ji Temple`, `Rebellion`, `Shakkyo` (lit. Stone Bridge) etc.
He participated in numerous Noh stages from famous mighty works to hidden items including 'Dojo-ji Temple,' 'Rebellion,' and 'Shakkyo' (lit. Stone Bridge) etc.
sen.cmt: わかりにくいと思うので再構成しました。

sen.j: メキシコ・アメリカ合衆国・中国の海外公演に参加。
sen.e: Motonobu went on to participate in performances on tour overseas in Mexico, USA and China.
Motonobu went on to participate in performances on tour overseas in Mexico, USA and China.
Motonobu went on to participate in performances on tour overseas in Mexico, USA and China.

sen.j: 1989年 東京藝術大学客員教授。
sen.e: 1989: Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music Associate Professor.
1989: Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music Associate Professor.
1989: Tokyo University of the Arts Associate Professor.

sen.j: 1999年 東京藝術大学を退官。
sen.e: 1999: Resigns from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music.
1999: Resigns from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music.
1999: Resigns from Tokyo University of the Arts.
2002: Receives the Order of Merit, Order of the Rising Sun.
2002: Receives the Order of Merit, Order of the Rising Sun.
2002: Receives 5th Class, the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Rays
sen.cmt: 勲章名を修正（勲5等を補足）

sen.j: 2007年 第28回観世寿夫記念法政大学能楽賞・第18回催花賞受賞。
sen.e: 2007: Was awarded the 28th Hosei University Hisao KANZE Memorial Noh Drama Prize and, 18th 催花賞 Prize.
2007: Was awarded the 28th Hosei University Hisao KANZE Memorial Noh Drama Prize and, 18th 催花賞 Prize.
2007: Was awarded the 28th Hosei University Hisao KANZE Memorial Noh Drama Prize and, 18th 催花賞 Prize.

sen.j: このほか国立能楽堂養成会主任講師・能楽宗家会理事・日本能楽会理事等を歴任。
sen.e: In addition, Motonobu is in charge of training at the National Noh Theatre, is leader of his family Noh line and, trustee of the Japan Noh Association.
In addition, Motonobu is in charge of training at the National Noh Theatre, is leader of his family Noh line and, trustee of the Japan Noh Association.
In addition, Motonobu is in charge of training at the National Noh Theatre, is leader of his family Noh line and, trustee of the Association for Japanese Noh Plays.

sen.j: 中央・地方各地で活動し囃子方を育成している。
sen.e: Matonobu is active in metropolitan and regional Japan and, in training Noh musicians.
Matonobu is active in metropolitan and regional Japan and, in training Noh musicians.
Matonobu is active in metropolitan and regional Japan and, in training Noh musicians.
